hypothesis_content.title: Gas/Price Divergence as SOL Relative Strength Signal
hypothesis_content.statement: When ETH experiences rising gas prices (>50% increase over 24h) while SOL gas fees remain stable during BULL/NEUTRAL regimes, SOL/BTC outperforms ETH/BTC over the next 5 trading days as capital seeks lower-fee alternatives.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High ETH gas creates migration incentives to alternative L1s. SOL's established ecosystem captures this flow when its network isn't congested, creating relative strength as traders seek lower-cost speculation venues.
entry_conditions: ETH gas price increases >50% over 24 hours
Both ETH and SOL in uptrend (above 20-day MA)

exit_conditions.take_profit: SOL/BTC ratio increases 8% relative to entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH gas prices drop below pre-spike levels

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: SOL/BTC fails to outperform ETH/BTC during 3+ ETH gas spike events
